The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a flattened, ribbon-like structure composed of closely packed cells. Gamotopea callithrix is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in harsh, dry conditions. Its ability to survive in such environments is due to its specialized structure and efficient water retention mechanisms.
